body_html: I am not against using PLATFORM_WINDOWS and COMPILER_MSVC if they are defined in header files and IWYU rule is enforced (this is what Chromium does), but -D for platform/compiler configuration should be avoided (that is, PLATFORM_WINDOWS should not come from tf_copts and COMPILER_MSVC should not come from CROSSTOOL).
body_text: I am not against using PLATFORM_WINDOWS and COMPILER_MSVC if they are defined in header files and IWYU rule is enforced (this is what Chromium does), but -D for platform/compiler configuration should be avoided (that is, PLATFORM_WINDOWS should not come from tf_copts and COMPILER_MSVC should not come from CROSSTOOL).
body: I am not against using `PLATFORM_WINDOWS` and `COMPILER_MSVC` if they are defined in header files and IWYU rule is enforced (this is what Chromium does), but `-D` for platform/compiler configuration should be avoided (that is, `PLATFORM_WINDOWS` should not come from `tf_copts` and `COMPILER_MSVC` should not come from `CROSSTOOL`).
